title: Authors and Citation
text: Giuliano Netto Flores Cruz. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Cruz, GNF (2022). Bayesian Decision Curve Analysis bayesDCA. R package version 0.0.0.9000. URL https://giulianonetto.github.io/bayesdca.
code: @Manual{,   title = {Bayesian Decision Curve Analysis with {bayesDCA}},   author = {Giuliano Netto Flores Cruz},   year = {2022},   url = {https://giulianonetto.github.io/bayesdca/},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000}, }

title: Bayesian Decision Curve Analysis
text: Perform Bayesian Decision Curve Analysis clinical prediction models diagnostic tests. validating clinical prediction model, may end AUC 0.79 slight miscalibration. know good enough model clinically useful? question can asked diagnostic test sensitivity 75% specificity 68%. Decision Curve Analysis helps us find answer - see Vickers, van Calster & Steyerberg, 2019 introduction DCA. , use Bayesian methods accurately quantify uncertainty decisions curves - powered Stan.

title: Bayesian Decision Curve Analysis
text: can install development version bayesDCA GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("giulianonetto/bayesdca")

title: Bayesian Decision Curve Analysis
text: can use bayesDCA evaluate predictive models well binary continuous tests - either diagnostic prognostic. plots either ggplot2 patchwork objects. plotting functions data_only argument one can access raw plotting data.

title: Bayesian Decision Curve Analysis
text: clinical prediction model (CPM), need patients’ outcomes (0 1) corresponding predictions (predicted probabilities).
code: library(bayesDCA) data(PredModelData) head(PredModelData) #>   outcomes predictions #> 1        0  0.01280653 #> 2        0  0.13981948 #> 3        0  0.03566458 #> 4        0  0.02351731 #> 5        0  0.00863298 #> 6        0  0.00959754 fit <- dca_predictive_model(outcomes = PredModelData$outcomes,                             predictions = PredModelData$predictions) plot(fit)

title: Bayesian Decision Curve Analysis
text: binary test, either diagnostic prognostic, just need specify sample size (N), number diseased patients events (d), number true positives (tp), number true negatives (tn).
code: library(bayesDCA) fit <- dca_binary_test(N = 500, d = 83, tp = 77, tn = 378) plot(fit)

title: Bayesian Decision Curve Analysis
text: can use plot_dca_list visualize multiple tests models simultaneously.  example, predictive model doesn’t seem add much diagnostic tests thresholds, although might overcome tests high thresholds (e.g. aove 40%). model requires multiple predictors, one migh prefer use simple binary tests - depending application, course. case, one may wonder test pick.
code: library(bayesDCA) # binary tests fit1 <- dca_binary_test(N = 1000, d = 120, tp = 80, tn = 800) fit2 <- dca_binary_test(N = 1000, d = 120, tp = 108, tn = 616) # predictive model data(PredModelData) fit3 <- dca_predictive_model(outcomes = PredModelData$outcomes,                              predictions = PredModelData$predictions) # plot decision curves plot_dca_list("test A" = fit1, "test B" = fit2, "model" = fit3)

title: Bayesian Decision Curve Analysis
text: want compare decision curves two models /tests, can provide fit objects compare_dca function.
code: library(bayesDCA)  # Test A: Se = 66%, Sp = 91% fit1 <- dca_binary_test(N = 1000, d = 120, tp = 80, tn = 800)  # Test B: Se = 90%, Sp = 70% fit2 <- dca_binary_test(N = 1000, d = 120, tp = 108, tn = 616) compare_dca("Test A" = fit1, "Test B" = fit2)

what: Continuous tests, scores, gene signatures, etc.
title: Bayesian Decision Curve Analysis
text: Categorization continuous predictors strongly discouraged, continuous tests different. also applies prognostic diagnostic scores, expression signatures, like. decisions often categorical, ’s better categorize outcome probabilities map probability thresholds back corresponding test values. end test cutoff either way, one clinically motivated - see Myth 2 Wynants et al, 2019. risk stratification procedure can applied seamlessly fitting single-predictor models (e.g. Disease ~ test_value). leads clinically-informed test cutoffs opposed observed-data arbitrariness (e.g. categorizing quantile score, yields arbitrary risk distributions score strata). Notice choosing appropriate risk threshold continuous test properly balances requirements sensitivity specificity according clinical context - cost correct incorrect decision. Whereas one may wish maximize sensitivity specificity simultaneously (e.g. pick “elbow” ROC curve), procedure effectively assumes false positives costs false negatives, usually dramatically incorrect. instance, screening test surely penalize false negatives way heavily false positives, confirmatory test cost false positives important. Hence, resulting test cutoff optimized clinical reasoning, data-driven artifacts. test cutoff, can compute tp tn proceed dca_binary_test usual. course, likely better approach use model take advantage (non-linear) relationship test values outcome probability, turns diagnostic/prognostic test study predictive model study - use dca_predictive_model case. Future versions bayesDCA include easy API task.

what: Survival data from Docking, 2021 - Figures 3B-3E — Docking2021Data
title: Survival data from Docking, 2021 - Figures 3B-3E — Docking2021Data
text: dataset containing survival data Docking, 2021. Dataset includes selected data used Figures 3B 3E. Observations missing survival time (weeks) missing survival events excluded. AML prognostic score (APS) values kept example continuous biomarker.

title: Survival data from Docking, 2021 - Figures 3B-3E — Docking2021Data
code: Docking2021Data

title: Survival data from Docking, 2021 - Figures 3B-3E — Docking2021Data
text: data frame 635 rows 5 variables: fig_id Character indicating corresponding figure original paper. aps_lasso_score APS value aps_lasso_class APS tercile computed within study cohort. survival_event Death 1, censored/slive 0. survival_weeks Overall survival weeks.

title: Survival data from Docking, 2021 - Figures 3B-3E — Docking2021Data
text: https://giulianonetto.github.io/bayesdca/

title: Predictive Model Evaluation Data. — PredModelData
text: dataset containing outcomes (0 1), probability predictions example model, results example binary test. Binary test generated using sensitivity specificity 80%. Based rmda::dcaData.

title: Predictive Model Evaluation Data. — PredModelData
code: PredModelData

title: Predictive Model Evaluation Data. — PredModelData
text: data frame 500 rows 3 variables: outcomes binary outcomes (0 1, int.) predictions predicted probabilities (num.) binary_test binary test results (0 1, int.)

title: Predictive Model Evaluation Data. — PredModelData
text: https://giulianonetto.github.io/bayesdca/

title: The 'bayesDCA' package. — bayesDCA-package
text: DESCRIPTION PACKAGE

title: The 'bayesDCA' package. — bayesDCA-package
text: Stan Development Team (2020). RStan: R interface Stan. R package version 2.21.2. https://mc-stan.org

title: Plot BayesDCAList comparison — compare_dca
text: Plot BayesDCAList comparison

title: Plot BayesDCAList comparison — compare_dca
code: compare_dca(   obj,   models_or_tests,   colors = NULL,   labels = NULL,   plot_list = FALSE,   ... )

title: Plot BayesDCAList comparison — compare_dca
text: obj BayesDCAList object colors Named vector color model test. provided subset models tests, subset plotted. labels Named vector label model test. plot_list TRUE, returns list separate ggplot objects.

title: Plot BayesDCAList comparison — compare_dca
text: patchwork/ggplot object list ggplot objects.

title: Plot BayesDCAList comparison — compare_dca
code: data(PredModelData) fit <- dca(PredModelData, cores = 4) compare_dca(fit) #> Error in models_or_tests %in% obj$model_or_test_names: argument "models_or_tests" is missing, with no default

what: Bayesian Decision Curve Analysis for Predictive Models and Binary tests — dca
title: Bayesian Decision Curve Analysis for Predictive Models and Binary tests — dca
text: Estimate decision curves list predictive models /binary tests . Necessary make comparative inferences across multiple models tests using corresponding posterior draws.

title: Bayesian Decision Curve Analysis for Predictive Models and Binary tests — dca
code: dca(   .data,   thresholds = seq(0.01, 0.5, 0.01),   keep_draws = TRUE,   keep_fit = FALSE,   prior_p = NULL,   prior_se = NULL,   prior_sp = NULL,   summary_probs = c(0.025, 0.975),   refresh = 0,   ... )

title: Bayesian Decision Curve Analysis for Predictive Models and Binary tests — dca
text: .data data.frame outcomes column (0 1 individual) one columns predicted probabilities desired list predictive models, 0 1 indicator desired list binary tests. thresholds Numeric vector probability thresholds net benefit computed (default seq(0, 0.5, 0.01)). keep_draws Logical indicating whether keep posterior draws stanfit object (default TRUE). keep_fit Logical indicating whether keep stanfit output (default FALSE). prior_p, prior_se, prior_sp Non-negative shape values Beta(alpha, beta) priors used p, Se, Sp, respectively. Default uniform prior parameters - Beta(1, 1). single vector form c(, b) can provided . refresh Control verbosity rstan::sampling (check help page details). ... Arguments passed rstan::sampling (e.g. iter, chains).

title: Bayesian Decision Curve Analysis for Predictive Models and Binary tests — dca
text: object class DCAList

title: Bayesian Decision Curve Analysis for Predictive Models and Binary tests — dca
code: data(PredModelData) fit <- dca(PredModelData, cores = 4) plot(fit)

title: Fit Bayesian Decision Curve Analysis using Stan for list of models or binary tests — .dca_stan_list
text: Fit Bayesian Decision Curve Analysis using Stan list models binary tests

title: Fit Bayesian Decision Curve Analysis using Stan for list of models or binary tests — .dca_stan_list
code: .dca_stan_list(   n_thr,   n_models_or_tests,   N,   d,   tp,   tn,   thresholds,   prior_p1,   prior_p2,   prior_Se1,   prior_Se2,   prior_Sp1,   prior_Sp2,   refresh = 0,   ... )

title: Fit Bayesian Decision Curve Analysis using Stan for list of models or binary tests — .dca_stan_list
text: n_thr Number thresholds (int.). n_models_or_tests Number models binary tests (int.). N Sample size (vector integers length n_thr). d Diseased: number diseased persons events (vector integers length n_thr). tp True Positives: number diseased persons correctly identified diagnostic test prediction model (matrix integers size n_thr n_models_or_tests). tn True Negatives: number diseased persons correctly identified diagnostic test prediction model (matrix integers size n_thr n_models_or_tests). thresholds Numeric vector probability thresholds net benefit computed (default seq(0.01, 0.5, 0.01)). refresh Control verbosity rstan::sampling. ... Arguments passed rstan::sampling (e.g. iter, chains). prior_p, prior_se, prior_sp Prior parameters prevalence, sensitivity, specificity (numeric matrices size n_thr n_models_or_tests).

title: Fit Bayesian Decision Curve Analysis using Stan for list of models or binary tests — .dca_stan_list
text: object class stanfit returned rstan::sampling (e.g. iter, chains)

text: n_thresholds Number thresholds (int.). n_models_or_tests Number models tests (int.). prior_p, prior_se, prior_sp Non-negative shape values Beta(alpha, beta) priors used p, Se, Sp, respectively. Default uniform prior parameters - Beta(1, 1). single vector form c(, b) can provided .

title: Simulate Diagnostic Test Data — simulate_diagnostic_test_data
text: Simulate Diagnostic Test Data

title: Simulate Diagnostic Test Data — simulate_diagnostic_test_data
code: simulate_diagnostic_test_data(   B = 100,   N = 500,   true_p = 0.2,   true_se = 0.9,   true_sp = 0.9,   keep_true_pars = FALSE )

title: Simulate Diagnostic Test Data — simulate_diagnostic_test_data
text: B Integer indicating number simulated datasets. N Integer indicating sample size dataset. true_p Proportion indicating true prevalence dataset. true_se Proportion indicating true sensitivity dataset. true_sp Proportion indicating true specificity dataset. keep_true_pars Logical indicating whether keep true parameter values output dataframe.

title: Simulate Diagnostic Test Data — simulate_diagnostic_test_data
text: Bx7 data frame simulated data provided parameters.

title: Simulate Diagnostic Test Data — simulate_diagnostic_test_data
text: Diagnostic test data simulated according following mechanism: B simulations, d diseased persons sampled binomial size N parameter true_p. , tp true positive outcomes sampled binomial size d parameter true_se, tn true negative outcomes sampled binomial size N-d parameter true_sp. simulates B diagnostic accuracy studies number diseased non-diseased persons sampled population; expected proportion diseased persons correctly detected sensitivity, number non-diseased persons correctly detected specificity.

title: Simulate Diagnostic Test Data — simulate_diagnostic_test_data
code: d <- simulate_diagnostic_test_data(B = 2,                                    N = 1000,                                    true_p = 0.2,                                    true_se = 0.9,                                    true_sp = 0.9) head(d) #>      N   d  tp  tn #> 1 1000 213 185 715 #> 2 1000 181 164 730
